claim_text: For the LLaVA 13B model, M3ID and M3ID+DPO reduce the percentage of hallucinated objects in captioning tasks by 25% and 28%, respectively, and improve the accuracy on VQA benchmarks such as POPE by 21% and 24%.
evidence_text: Specifically, for the LLaVA 13B model, M3ID and M3ID+DPO reduce the percentage of hallucinated objects in captioning tasks by 25% and 28%, respectively, and improve the accuracy on VQA benchmarks such as POPE by 21% and 24%.
justification_conclusion: True. The improvements in metrics demonstrate the effectiveness of M3ID and its extension in enhancing visual grounding and reducing hallucinations.

claim_text: We propose a visual prompt dependency measure (PDM) to assess whether a model output is ungrounded with respect to the visual input.
evidence_text: We propose to study hallucinations on VLMs using PDMs defined as dist(p(·|y<t, x, c), p(·|y<t, x)), where dist is any distance measure between probability distributions, such as Hellinger.
justification_conclusion: Ture. This measure provides a quantitative way to evaluate the dependence of outputs on visual inputs, aiding in diagnosing and mitigating hallucinations.

claim_text: Our results show that M3ID enhances the dependence on the visual prompt and reduces the number of hallucinations across various benchmarks while preserving the linguistic fluency of the original model.
